New Records: The White Sox are approaching the record for most losses in a season, set by the 1962 New York Mets.
The White Sox bullpen has the second-worst ERA in the American League.
Key Match Events: The game went into 13 innings with the White Sox blowing leads in the 8th, 10th, and 11th innings.
Jairo Iriarte surrendered a walk-off RBI single to Jordyn Adams in the bottom of the 13th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox were focused on their next series, emphasizing one game at a time.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore discussed missed opportunities and the team's struggles to close games.
Andrew Vaughn contributed with a home run in the fourth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox have lost 22 games where they led after six innings, highlighting their closing issues.
